facts: In the Bible, a lamb is a symbol of innocence and is used to point to sacrifice and God’s care for His people.
A rainbow symbolizes God’s promise after the flood, reminding readers of hope and faithfulness.
In the story of Jonah, the great fish becomes a symbol of rescue and a second chance to obey God.
A mustard seed is used as a symbol to show that even small faith can grow into something strong and life-changing.
Light often symbolizes guidance and goodness, such as when God’s word is described as a lamp for a person’s path.
Bread is a symbol of daily provision and dependence on God, and it is also connected to important meals in Bible stories.
A shepherd and sheep symbolize leadership and protection, showing how God guides people like a shepherd leads a flock.
sources_hint: Common Bible passages featuring these symbols include Genesis 9 (rainbow), Jonah 1–2 (great fish), Matthew 13 (mustard seed), Psalm 119 (lamp/light), John 6 (bread), and Psalm 23 or John 10 (shepherd).
